caption: So disappointed, we came last week to find them closed without notice. Then came back mind you we are 1st timers, I got the cake sundae and my cake was hard as a rock and the strawberry ice cream quality was like eating fruity pebbles. We also had the funnel cake fries which were like sugar sticks, too sweet. Won't be returning! You stand in line for 30 minutes for poor quality food.

Arrived at 6 and even though hours say they close at 7, the windows are down but still lit up. A woman was inside is cleaning and doing everything she can to avoid eye contact. At one point standing directly in front of us but refused to lift her head up. I have no issue if you decide to close early but put a sign up or at least acknowledge your customers and let them know you closed early. First time attempting to visit but will definitely be our last if this is indicative of customer service and staff quality.
Food is good, just a bit overpriced. It’s D.C so I expect nothing less 🤷🏾‍♀️.
I went there trying to get those good looking crab sandwiches but unfortunately were out. These 5 stars are for the service though. Girl upfront was super nice.
This place is so tasty good and the employee are very friendly and helpful.

I wanted a single scoop of cookies n cream ice cream. It was 4.67. I paid with 5 dollars. They said they didn’t have any change. I said it’s fine. After waiting 14 minutes I went up to the counter and asked where my single scoop of ice cream was. The girl at the counter said “oh we don’t even have that order up here. One sec” terrible customer service experience all around. The ice cream was ok at best.
Great food and friendly staff.
Ice cream chip which with vanilla ice cream on a snicker doodle cookie is always a hit.

Service is a bit slow. Soft serve ice cream- not a whole lot of options, there. Pricy, but I suppose that’s due to the location. The staff was friendly and the root beer float wasn’t bad at all. It wasn’t possible to walk towards the water within the enclosure, without going to a totally different part of the wharf. There were fences preventing you from even going to the seafood area. Not sure if this is Covid-restriction related or if that’s just how it was before.
That's my teacher's shop

Best soft serve ice cream ever! It is so smooth and creamy with just the right amount of sweetness and vanilla! I had vanilla in a medium cup (but wish I gotten the large). There’s always tomorrow!  Sorry about the photo, it was basically gone by the time I thought to take a picture.
Their food/desserts were sooo good! The line gets long, but it’s most definitely worth the wait.
I got the cake explosion and it was amazing!! It wasn’t too long a wait and the staff was very nice. Definitely would recommend!
I ordered the cake explosion And it was good, but they forget ALL my toppings. By the time I went back they were closed. So disappointing!!
Long wait with no one in line. Employees wearing items with their uniform that werent presentable.
I had the cake explosion and it was so good! They even had a cookie on the bottom 😌😌 superfilling. So if you're looking for a light dessert, I would stick to their regular ice cream scoops
Great ice cream and a variety of options like floats!!! Love it.

The ice cream is awesome but the service is terrible.   They act like their father is making them work at the shop.  I definitely can't tell it's their shop based on their attitudes.  I don't mind supporting a black business but do I have to be mistreated.

Have to support black businesses!! I would say the customer crevice could've been a little better and I did not like waiting for an hour in the heat, but when I got to the front and recieved my ice cream, I was a happy camper. Ill just come back in the fall/winter when they ones are a little shorter lol

The customer service was terrible and my strawberry ice cream tasted like vanilla. So I live in California and I wanted to support this black owned business when I came to DC. I placed two orders. One order came out first. I waited about 10 minutes before I asked them about my second order meanwhile my first order had already melted. The owner told me that I was miss informed about the mango ice cream. It was mango shaved ice . So I asked the owner if she could remake my first order and she said no bcus it was already out of the window. She said no. Nevertheless, the customer service was terrible, they were all over the place with orders. Instead of folks getting both of their orders simultaneously, o e order was given and then someone else's order was given and then back to your order. I was better off going to Dairy Queen
Great ice cream and service was extraordinary!
Customer service is bad...Don’t eat from a place that don’t take good care of their customers they probably don’t take good care of their food either😒
I really wanted to like this place especially since it’s black owned....The cashier was beyond rude didn’t really want anything after talking to her. Disappointed.

They stole money from me. I was going to buy ice cream from here they didn’t have the kind I wanted so I canceled it. They still charged my card for it and when I talked to them about the problem, the lady told me I was crying over 5dollars...Not professional at all  very ghetto if you ask me. I support black own businesses but not this one.
Great ice cream w/ original menu items!! Great customer service too!!
Love it!!! Support Black Business!!!
Best Cookies and Cream shake in the DMV! The only reason I brave The Wharf. Hopeful for more locations!

I went because saw their segment on CNN.  I went today and drove from College Park.  I got to the area around noon to coincide with their opening for the day and beat the crowds; well no such luck, but line wasn't that bad.  It is a hot day 80°+ and parking was tough to find which seema to be typical to the area. What disappointed me is there is no online menu that I could coordinate with my sheltered family at home and my inability to capture good picture to due to the glare from my phone nor the glare on glare from the PPE barrier with the cashier.   Nevertheless the milkshake and cup/cones ice cream I drove 14miles to get was delicious.  While I had to wait a minute for the order fulfillment one of the sister/owners waited on me who was gracious and attentive to my concerns about transporting this precious cargo.  The order was received home to rave reviews and a.promise to return...soon.  Thanks you!

When we passed thru DC earlier this year, we were directed to try their tasty treats and I am so thankful for the recommendation.  Hopefully thru covid, they continue to be successful! If you're in the area, definitely give them a try, you won't be disappointed.
Shared a Great Day and had the best Ice Cream from SWSPP. THANKS FAMILY!

Instagram sent me here........I'm giving the business 3 stars seeing that I ordered the cheesy crab melt and mistakenly requested cheesy crab melt fries. I was immediately corrected by the cashier in which she stated in a condescending tone of voice "we don't have cheesy crab melt fries" in the same same breath she should have utilized that time to express what the crab melt consisted of. I decided to order anyways without further question seeing that instagram promoted the item well. Turns out , I received  what seemed to be a texas toast melt with mostly bread and little crab meat. It was overpriced for what I recieved. Tasty though which is why I am giving it 3 stars. Needless to say the funnel cake fries were a hit and the strawberry shortcake bites were tasty as well.
Love the birthday cake cone! Fast and friendly service as well.
Great ice cream and funnel cake fries! Staff were friendly and it was easy to social distance because of all the outdoor space.
Fantastic chipwich. I got birthday cake ice cream with chocolate chip cookies. The staff is so sweet and they should be proud of their shop!
Surprisingly rude staff and ice cream was not good, almost tasted watered down  I wouldn't come back

Southwest Soda Pop Shop is a locally owned food stand in the District Wharf near the historic fish market. There is no inside seating, but there are places to stand and eat nearby. There's also a little seating area around the corner with seating on steps. In terms of food, they offer the basics like hot dogs and lemonade. They also have ice cream that's popular!
Line was long, but well worth the wait.  Had a smoothie that was excellent and friends had ice cream.

I like the all vegan ice cream, staff very pleasant and courteous. Could please add two more cash registrrs to the current ones so the queue can move faster? It takes too long to get to what you want due to the fact that you only have to order windows.

Waited in line for about 20 minutes around 2:00 on a Saturday. Very nice people and great treats! Can’t wait to come back and try other flavors! Wanted to come out to support a local black owned family business!
The ice cream here was amazing
THE DECOR  IS NICE,  THE STAFF  WERE FRIENDLY,  REASONABLE  PRICE, THE ATMOSPHERE  IS DOPE, THE ICE CREAM  😋. BEAUTIFUL  VIEW AND POSITIVE  ENERGY
I LOVE IT

I was originally introduced to SW Soda Pop Shop via Facebook and decided to visit after a friend recommended it. I ordered the Cake Explosion and a Vanilla Shake. Both were fantastic! I enjoyed the real ingredients in their menu items. The staff was very kind! I will certainly be back!
Very tasty and the ladies there were so nice and kind. I will be going back!

i love it because it is black owned and I support always black owned business. Milkshakes were good too! They were a little runny, I think because it was hot. And there was a long line- but otherwise very good.
Awesome, locally owned ice cream shop. Great prices.

Cute little ice cream and milkshake booth. They also serve hot dogs and funnel cake fries. Perfect place if you need something sweet. Prices weren’t bad. They had a few combo deals as well. I had the soft serve ice cream and my friend had a milkshake and they were okay.

Service was horrible.....Let me tell you why.... cashier was not friendly had no customer service skills 👎🏾 Had none of the listed items we wanted.... and was told “I didn’t think ppl wanted ice cream since it’s cold outside”...Ummmm then why are you opened? Will not be going back.
Cute little no frills sweet shop.
Total yumness
My Wife got a Shake and a Cone,  I got a cookie and some Funnel Cake Fries.  It was all sooooo good.
Great ice cream, both soft serve and scooped. The line can be long but moves pretty quickly unless someone orders things that take a lot of prep like shakes. The family that owns it is super nice!
Still my wife's favorite soft serve ice cream place in the whole of the DMV!

I walked over to support this business while at work and was greeted by a “BRB” sign stating that they went to the bathroom.  I waited 15 minutes and the young lady walked by us not saying a word and proceeded the opposite direction from the store. I asked her were they going to open up and she stated, “I am going to the bathroom”. Excuse me, do you not see customers here waiting? We stood outside this establishment for 15 minutes thinking you had already gone to the bathroom.  My son has visited this place a few times and love the ice cream but said this young lady ALWAYS have a nasty attitude. Unbelievable!
Just ok

This is a great outdoor quick ice cream shop. The staff is cool and the smoothie I ordered was good. They offer all kinds of ice cream, banana splits, milk shakes, smoothies and more. They have ice cream sandwhiches made of real cookies and your choice of ice-cream flavor.

The smoothies and milkshakes are amazing. They make them with a personal touch.  This family owned shop is well needed and well appreciated.  I will go again and again. The customer service is absolutely genuine with a smile.
Everything was great
Located in the busy Wharf be ready to wait in line on the weekends. I ordered a soft served vanilla cone with brownie pieces.

So good! A must stop ice cream shop at the wharf on the fresh seafood side. Pictured is the cherry blossom ice cream sandwich on sugar cookies. Ask about their secret menu. This is a walk up shop with no indoor seating. There are some pub tables outside. On my last visit they were selling hotdogs and half smokes as well as ice cream.
I love this place! Its black owned and run by a family and they were are so nice and welcoming. Root beer float with soft serve ice cream was yummy.
Great ice cream, great customer service. I had the cookies and cream and my husband had the vanilla soft serve. They were both great, and the soft serve is so delicious.
Had to walk away because the cashier working was more interested in her phone than assisting. Had a disappointed  3 year old
High quality treats & friendly staff! Soft serve flavors: vanilla, chocolate, vanilla/chocolate twist, mango, raspberry, mango/raspberry twist
Great ice cream, amazing people.

Southwest Soda Pop Shop is a cute outdoor ice cream and soda stand. Serving soft serve and scoop ice creams , floats, and sodas. A wonderful stop on the north end of the newly opened DC Wharf. Look closely for the shop since there is still a lot of construction. It is located on Maine Ave directly in front of the Seafood Market. There is ample bench seating under a shaded awning. It will be even nicer to visit once the construction is completed.
